ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is really good. I recommend it to another student because it does help you a lot for your future research using matlab.
Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone who is interested in numerical method. Because you really learn a lot of things although the homework load is a little heavy.
A very good course for one looking for knowledges on programming and numerical method.
Yes. It is very useful and learning in this class is satisfying.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students majoring in engineering or natural science. Because they can learn a lot of methods to solve different problems, such as ODEs, PDEs, matrixs and non-linear equations. The training in coding is also appreciated and helpful for future career.

Highly recommend this course if you are interested in applied math and want to hone your programming skills.The work load is above average, but the problem sets help you really understand the methods being taught.Great teacher, no text book to buy.
I would say it requires a lot of work. Be prepared, and it will definitely worth the time.
I would only recommend it if they needed to solve ode's or pde's numerically for their research

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It could provide me a way for understand my discipline more quantitatively. I think this course contribute to my research by teaching me to use matlab to solve numerous problems.
Very helpful to enginnering students like me.
It is very useful for my research because I deal with a lot of calculations
This course helps me solve different types of PDEs and ODEs, which I may encounter in the fulture research.
I will use the methods for modeling in the future.
